channel.title: math.OA updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.OA updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Continuous-variable designs and design-based shadow tomography from random lattices
item.description: arXiv:2412.17909v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We investigate state designs for continuous-variable quantum systems using the aid of lattice-like quantum states. These are code states of Gottesman-Kitaev-Preskill (GKP) codes. We show that for an n-mode system, the set of all GKP states forms a rigged continuous-variable state 2-design. We use these lattice state designs to construct a continuous variable shadow tomography protocol, derive sample complexity bounds for both global- and local GKP shadows under reasonable physical assumptions, and provide the physical gadgets needed to implement this protocol.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Conrad, Joseph T. Iosue, Ansgar G. Burchards, Victor V. Albert

item.title: Toeplitz algebras and the Heisenberg group
item.description: arXiv:2412.18266v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We show an isomorphism between an algebra which is naturally constructed from the Toeplitz algebra generated by d-shifts, and an ideal of the C * -algebra of the (2d + 1)-dimensional Heisenberg group. This is a particular case of a more general result for graded nilpotent Lie groups involving symbols in the filtered calculus. The proof presented here however only involves basic functional analysis while still showcasing the ideas of the proof in the general setting.
item.dc:creator: Cl\'ement Cren (LAMA)

item.title: Infinite graph product of groups II: Analytic properties
item.description: arXiv:2412.18313v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We study analytic properties of graph product of finite groups with a hyperbolic defining graph. This is done by studying dynamics on the Bowditch compactification of the extension graph, or the crossing graph, of graph product. In particular, we provide a new class of convergence groups and identify the if and only if condition for this convergence action to be geometrically finite. We also provide a new class of properly proximal groups, relatively bi-exact groups, and groups with strongly solid group von Neumann algebras.
item.dc:creator: Koichi Oyakawa

item.title: Maximality of correspondence representations
item.description: arXiv:2407.04278v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper, we fully characterize maximal representations of a C*-correspondence. This strengthens several earlier results. We demonstrate the criterion with diverse examples. We also describe the noncommutative Choquet boundary and provide additional counterexamples to Arveson's hyperrigidity conjecture following the counterexample recently found by the author and Adam Dor-On.
item.dc:creator: Boris Bilich

item.title: Class field towers and minimal models
item.description: arXiv:2108.13470v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We use the notion of an Etesi $C^*$-algebra to prove that the real class field towers are always finite.
item.dc:creator: Igor V. Nikolaev
